intro: Leschenaultia peregrina, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Himalayas. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate, and its flowers are small, white or pale pink, arranged in a raceme. Leschenaultia peregrina is known for its ability to thrive in cold, arid conditions, making it well adapted to high-altitude habitats. It is often found in meadows and on slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
